alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 22 at 6:27PM PST until January 23 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor beach erosion and minor tidal overflow. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until midnight PST tonight. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Minor beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The time of greatest concern will be during morning high tide which will range between 7.0 and 7.3 feet between 730 AM and 900 AM this weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
